answers.answer: You're absolutely right about the range.  AACE defines it as 0.3-3.0.Your TSH is telling you that you might be a bit hypo and need more testing.  Your next step would be to have free T3 (FT3) and free T4 (FT4) tested to confirm this.  Do you have hypo symptoms?  FT3 correlates best to symptoms, followed by FT4, and TSH really is not even a contender.If FT3 and FT4 confirm hypothyroidism, you might then want to have antibodies testing (TPOab and TGab) to see if you have an autoimmune condition.

question: ok I got the results on paper. for diabetes and TSH.Urine:Deep Yellow and Hazy. PH=6.0 Protein was tracedMucus (++)Glucose Fasting: 90.3CBC: Haemogoblin 16.1ESR: mm/hr <50 years <15mm/hrTSH: 3.7I heard for the TSH can be by the AACE which is 3.0 is the maximum normal range.
